subject: Questions About Cole's Funny Picture Book
msgSnippet: Hello, I m a new member and I m just learning QuickScript.  I really appreciate all the easily accessible information that s available here and elsewhere on
messageBody:
Hello,
I'm a new member and I'm just learning QuickScript. I really
appreciate all the easily accessible information that's available
here and elsewhere on the web... I've read the Quickscript Manual (at
least through the "junior" part) and I've skimmed through most of
this eGroup's past posts.

I've been gradually memorizing the alphabet over the past few weeks
(using the "Revised Shaw Alphabet of Kingsley Read", by Jon Zuck) and
I have several things that I'm unclear about. But before I post my
questions, I'd like to make sure they haven't already been answered
in the available QuickScript documents.

I have seen many references to "Cole's Funny Picture Book No.2", but
I haven't been able to locate any sources for this book. I've
searched all my usual on-line bookstores (Amazon, Alibris, ABE, etc)
and I've had a few "close encounters", but I haven't been able to
find the exact book (1979, 71st surprise edition). So I was
wondering whether anyone can tell me where I might locate a copy.
Perhaps even more valuable, can anyone offer advice about whether
finding and reading this book would really be worthwhile for a
beginner?

Thank you,
Jeff Smith

Hello,
I'm a new member and I'm just learning QuickScript.  I really 
appreciate all the easily accessible information that's available 
here and elsewhere on the web... I've read the Quickscript Manual (at 
least through the "junior" part) and I've skimmed through most of  
this eGroup's past posts.

I've been gradually memorizing the alphabet over the past few weeks 
(using the "Revised Shaw Alphabet of Kingsley Read", by Jon Zuck) and 
I have several things that I'm unclear about.  But before I post my

I have seen many references to "Cole's Funny Picture Book No.2", but 
I haven't been able to locate any sources for this book.  I've 
searched all my usual on-line bookstores (Amazon, Alibris, ABE, etc) 
and I've had a few "close encounters", but I haven't been able to 
find the exact book (1979, 71st surprise edition).  So I was 
wondering whether anyone can tell me where I might locate a copy.  
Perhaps even more valuable, can anyone offer advice about whether 
finding and reading this book would really be worthwhile for a 
beginner?

Thank you,
Jeff Smith
